## CubemapSHProjector.projectCubemap() method

Projects a cubemap texture into spherical harmonics coefficients and stores them in a GPUBuffer.

The method performs Monte Carlo integration over the sphere to compute the first 9 SH coefficients. The results are written to a 3x3 render target where each pixel contains RGB values for one SH coefficient. The layout is: - (0,0): Y₀₀ (0,1): Y₁₋₁ (0,2): Y₁₀ - (1,0): Y₁₁ (1,1): Y₂₋₂ (1,2): Y₂₋₁ - (2,0): Y₂₀ (2,1): Y₂₁ (2,2): Y₂₂

**Signature:**

```typescript
projectCubemap(cubemap: TextureCube, outBuffer: GPUDataBuffer, radianceSource?: boolean): void;
```

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

cubemap


</td><td>

[TextureCube](doc/markdown/./device.texturecube.md)


</td><td>

The input cubemap texture to project


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

outBuffer


</td><td>

[GPUDataBuffer](doc/markdown/./device.gpudatabuffer.md)


</td><td>

GPU data buffer to receive the computed SH coefficients. Must be large enough to hold 9 RGB values (36 floats for RGBA32F format).


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

radianceSource


</td><td>

boolean


</td><td>

_(Optional)_


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

void

## Example


```typescript
const shBuffer = device.createDataBuffer(9 * 4 * 4); // 9 coefficients * 4 components * 4 bytes
projector.projectCubemap(environmentMap, shBuffer);
```
